meanings.definition: A person of low social status who works on the land
meanings.sent1: The peasants toil in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: The village was filled with hardworking peasants.
meanings.sent3: The peasants joked about their muddy boots after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The fields whispered secrets to the peasants as they worked.
meanings.sent5: The image of the tired peasants carrying baskets of crops stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A member of a class of small farmers or farm laborers
meanings.sent1: Peasants often grow their own food on small plots of land.
meanings.sent2: The peasants gathered at the market to sell their produce.
meanings.sent3: The peasants celebrated a good harvest with a feast.
meanings.sent4: The village was a tapestry woven by the hands of the peasants.
meanings.sent5: The laughter of the peasants echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The peasants lived a simple life in the countryside.
meanings.sent2: The old man was a true peasant, content with nature's gifts.
meanings.sent3: The peasants danced under the stars on warm summer nights.
meanings.sent4: The wind carried the songs of the peasants across the fields.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh bread baking reminded the peasants of home.
